awd_titl_txt: Presidential Young Investigator Award:  Research in Design  Automation
awd_abstract_narration: This research outlines a formal and unifying theory concerning             (i) the process of design, namely that it can be succinctly and                 simply defined to be a model of computability, (ii) the artifacts of            design as enumerated strings from a formal design grammar, and (iii)            the rules of design as formal state changes that govern the string              enumeration.                                                                         The artifacts of engineering design of discrete goods, as                  strings in a formal language, can be discussed in terms of solid                modeling as the kernel of a boundary based modeling system, rooted              in a language of topologically valid representations of rigid solids            as connected, 2-manifolds.  This 3D representation grammar includes             (i) a set of face-based Euler operators as well as (ii) their                   semantics.  Since inclusion of both elements provides necessary and             sufficient conditions for solidity, one can prove topological                   validity of the representation scheme.
org_div_long_name: Division of Civil, Mechanical, and Manufacturing Innovation
